title: National donor register would prevent 'potential trauma', advocate says | Stateline | ABC NEWS
description: A growing number of South Australians are using the state's donor conception register to find the missing pieces of their genetic history. The Australian-first online register was established last year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donor births and prompting calls for a national scheme. title: The sacking of Amorim and the United doom loop
description: Manchester United spent more than 400-million pounds in fourteen months to try and support the Ruben Amorim vision... only to decide it was the wrong course of action. Craig Foster unpacks the latest chapter of a once mighty empire now stuck in a doom loop.Â    Featured: Craig Foster, ex-Australia footballer and Stan Sport analyst. title: 'Big four' banks weigh on ASX, oil prices near five-year low | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Doubts have emerged about the economics of Donald Trump's plan for America's big oil companies to exploit Venezuela's vast oil reserves, given the price of Brent crude is around its lowest in five years.  On Wall Street, the Dow Jones index climbed to a new record high, while steep falls in the share price of Commonwealth Bank, Westpac, NAB and ANZ dragged the Australian share market lower, as finance presenter David Chau explains. title: Beloved cat Sassy reunites with owner after serious injury in bushfire | ABC NEWS
description: After upwards of $50,000 in specialist veterinary care, a cat seriously injured in the Koolewong bushfires on the NSW Central Coast has made a remarkable recovery. Sassy has been reunited with her owner Siew Lee Seow, whose home was destroyed in the blaze. Crowdfunding efforts helped cover the vet bill, which included amputations and skin grafts. title: Report warns Australian cities could see bushfires like 2025 LA wildfires | ABC NEWS
description: A new report concludes that Australian cities are not immune from fires like those that ravaged Los Angeles in January of 2025. "It is not a matter of if, but when" an Australian city will be hit by such a blaze, according to the report by the Climate Council and Emergency Leaders for Climate Action. The report puts forward "key areas of focus" that could help reduce the fire risks Australia faces, which include cutting pollution and investing in disaster preparation. title: Maduro declares he's still Venezuelan president in first US court appearance | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Days after US forces raided Venezuela and arrested its President, NicolÃ¡s Maduro pleaded not guilty to drugs charges, telling the court he was a prisoner of war. 00:41 Both supporters of and protesters against the US's actions were in the courtroom and stood outside during the trial, with one man in the public gallery shouting President Maduro would "pay for his crimes". 01:55 The Venezuelan government has launched a crackdown on dissent and celebrations, with the country's newly sworn in leader pledging her allegiance to Maduro's regime. 03:27 Neighbouring Colombia is on alert, with fears they'll be the next country to be attack by US forces. 04:22 Denmark's Prime Minister says if the US attacks Greenland, as alluded to by President Trump, it will mark the end of NATO. 05:17 Europe Correspondent Kathryn Diss says European leaders, including the UK's Keir Starmer, are taking the US's statements about Greenland seriously, but are walking a tightrope in not condemning the Venezuelan attack. 06:40 With fears of a similar attack on Iran, the death toll from a crackdown on anti-government protests there has risen to 35. Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2026-01-06/venezuela-maduro-in-court-new-york-live-blog-january-6/106201828  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Why many Venezuelans are celebrating US capture of Nicolas Maduro | The World | ABC News
description: During Nicolas Maduro's time in power, Venezuela's economy effectively collapsed under the weight of hyper-inflation, chronic shortages and human rights abuses. Maduro's tenure also saw millions leave the country, including Santiago Vidal Calvo, who lives in Texas and is the Cities Policy Analyst at the Manhattan Institute. He explains to The World's Girish Sawlani why he supports the deposed Venezuelan leader's capture at the hands of US forces. #ABCTheWorld #abcasiapacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
